Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant with enough water and light.
The student can draw a wilting or unhealthy plant that is not getting enough water.
The student can show through drawings the difference in plant appearance with and without water.
The student can illustrate the idea that plants die or do not grow well without water.
The student can depict the importance of sunlight and water for plant growth through illustrations.
